title: The Shrine
visuals: ASCII_Overlay: The room is filled with candle-flame artifacts (flickering '^' symbols). Faces in photos are pixelated.
lighting: Candlelight only. Warm orange glow against cold concrete walls.
audio: Dripping water, distant wind through broken windows, the occasional creak of settling debris.
smell: Candle wax, mold, old paper, faint chemical residue.
narrative: You emerge into a basement. It's not a bunker; it's a shrine. Walls are covered in photos from 15 years ago. Candles burn everywhere.
gmNotes: This is the first major clue that the 'Gas Leak' was a murder, not an accident.

npcs.name: Jaxson 'Jax' V.
npcs.notes: Visibly uncomfortable. Recognizes faces in the photos but says nothing.
npcs.motivation: Wants to get through this room as quickly as possible. The guilt is overwhelming.
npcs.personality: Evasive, tense, avoids eye contact. Will deflect questions about the photos.

challenges.description: Search the shrine for clues about what happened here.

success_effect.text: You find a 'Wall of the Missing'. You spot a photo of a 15-year-old boy. The face analysis matches Jaxson V. with 99.9% accuracy.

failure_effect.text: You find medical logs. They list 'Genetic Organ Failure' as the cause of death for dozens of people - all within the same month. The same thing happening to Jax.

challenges.description: Examine the offerings left at the shrine.

success_effect.text: Among the offerings, you find an empty bottle of 'Bio-Dyne Pure' water. The label is faded but readable. Why would they leave corporate water at a memorial?

failure_effect.text: The offerings are personal effects - photos, toys, jewelry. Nothing useful.

triggers.label: Jax's Discomfort
triggers.text: Jax stares at the photos. His hands are shaking. He won't meet your eyes.
